definition: namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near

sentences.english: The police detective got a line on where the thief was hiding and soon after apprehended him.
sentences.chinese: 警察得到小偷藏匿處的線索，迅即逮捕了他。

sentences.english: It is hoped that immediate action will be taken on this matter.
Wherever life first flickered into being, it may have moved rapidly to occupy a wide range of environments.
sentences.chinese: 無論生命在哪裏閃亮登場，都會迅即佔據大片環境。

sentences.english: Where free speech is stopped miasma is bred, and death comes fast.
sentences.chinese: 如果言論自由被中止了，瘴氣就滋生，死亡迅即來臨。

sentences.english: Quickly down the ax, Pide cracking his skull, but no blood flow.
sentences.chinese: 迅即而下的斧頭，劈得他顱骨開裂，卻沒有血液流出。

sentences.english: Liang Jan hastily accompanied his wife back to the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 粱江乃迅即陪同他的妻子回到山上。

sentences.english: The firm immediately switched to the more conservative deficit forecast.
sentences.chinese: 標普迅即轉而採用了對美國財政赤字更爲保守的預測。

sentences.english: The mini-skirt caught on quickly but disappeared equally fast.
sentences.chinese: 迷你裙迅即流行，但是很快就被打入冷宮。

definition: in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
